page.title: 02Communications
page.content: Post Office There is only one Post Office in our area. The sub-postmistress is called Mrs Burrows. In our 12 squares there are four post boxes. When the postman delivers the letters it takes him five and a half hours to complete his round. There are four people who do the Sampford Arundel round. They take it in turns every week. At Christmas there are between 2,000 and 3,000 letters a week. There is one collection in the morning and one in the afternoon. Telephone Exchange Although Greenham is a small village there is a Telephone Exchange. A lot of numbers are Greenham numbers in our area. The longest Greenham number is ten digits. Some people in Sampford have Greenham numbers.
